metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27786 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s implementation of MIDI, where an attacker with a local account and the permissions to issue ioctl commands to midi devices could trigger a use-after-free issue. A write to this specific memory while freed and before use causes the flow of execution to change and possibly allow for memory corruption or privilege escalation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-185.215

linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.121').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.78~16.04.1').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.83').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
